Detect Magic.name: 侦测魔法 Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手 Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
一只漂浮的幽灵手出现在施法距离内你指定的一点。幽灵手持续存在至法术终止。如果幽灵手距你的距离超过 30 尺，或者当你再次施展了该法术时，则现存的幽灵手消失不见。

你可以在施展该法术时使用幽灵手实施一个行为：你可以操控一个物件，或者打开一扇未上锁的门或容器，或者将一件物品放入或取出一个打开的容器，或者将小瓶中的内容物倾倒出来。

在后续的回合中，以一个魔法动作，你可以控制幽灵手再次实施一个行为。作为那个动作的一部分，你可以令幽灵手移动至多 30 尺。

该幽灵手不能攻击，也不能激活魔法物品或承载超过 10 磅重的物质。

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
一阵震耳欲聋的噪音在你指定的施法距离内一点上爆发出来。以该点为中心半径 10 尺球状区域内的所有生物必须要进行一次体质豁免。豁免失败将受到 3d8 点雷鸣伤害；豁免成功受到半数伤害。构装生物进行该豁免时具有劣势。

如果法术的范围内存在不被任何生物着装携带的非魔法物件，则它也要受到该伤害。

升环施法： 使用高于二环的法术位施展该法术时，使用的法术位每比二环高一环，法术伤害就增加 1d8。

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Sending.name: Sending
Sending.description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a creature you have met or a creature described to you by someone who has met it. The target hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables targets to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn’t arrive. You know if the delivery fails.

Upon receiving your message, a creature can block your ability to reach it again with this spell for 8 hours. If you try to send another message during that time, you learn that you are blocked, and the spell fails.

Cloaked Flight.name: Cloaked Flight
Cloaked Flight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili] on itself, and it can fly up to half its Fly Speed. The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Sonic Boom.name: Sonic Boom
Sonic Boom.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShatter000]{Shatter} (level 3 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Tail Swipe.name: Tail Swipe
Tail Swipe.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Ancient Copper Dragon.name: Ancient Copper Dragon
Ancient Copper Dragon.description:
Copper Dragons

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.1gZk82d5dqtIeB4K caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Ancient Copper Dragon

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.JZSMBqM2jcAR6Id8 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Copper Dragon Lairs

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.CcknwGjBYkv7PPRI caption=false cite=false]

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性 Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Slowing Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 5 version).

Acid Breath.name: Acid Breath
Acid Breath.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 5 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShapechang]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplProjectIma]{Project Image}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Mind Spike.name: Mind Spike
Mind Spike.description:
You drive a spike of psionic energy into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spiked.name: Spiked
Spiked.description: You always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束，详见以下对应效应的描述。你可以再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

生物用研究动作调查该声响或影像时，其必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免 DC 的[[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]]检定，检定成功则判断出是幻象。对于识破幻象的生物而言，幻象会变得模糊不清。

声响。 如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

影像。 如果你创造一个物件的影像，比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等，则该物件各方向上大小不得大于 5 尺立方区域。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物体穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can’t be a Construct or an Undead.

When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The spell ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
你触碰一名生物并魔法性地移除目标身上的下列效应之一：

  • 1 级 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]{力竭}
  • &Reference[Charmed apply=false]{魅惑}或&Reference[Petrified apply=false]{石化}状态
  • 一道诅咒，包括目标因与一件被诅咒魔法物品的同调所陷入的诅咒。
  • 目标某项属性值的减损
  • 目标生命值上限的降低

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
你创造一个影像，其形象来自一个大小不超过边长 20 尺立方体的物件或生物，或是其他的可视现象。影像出现在施法距离内你能看见的一处位置并在法术持续时间内维持存在。它看起来完全是真实的，并且还具有相应的声音、气味和温度。但它无法造成伤害或让人陷入任何状态。

在该幻象施法距离内时，你可以用一个魔法动作将影像移动到施法距离内的另一个位置。影像改变位置时，你可以改变影像的外表来使它移动得更自然。例如，如果你创造了一个生物的影像并移动它，则你可以改变影像，使它看起来就像是在走路。或者你也可以让影像在不同的时间发出不同的声音，甚至可以让它参与一场对话。

由于影像可以被穿过，任何与该影像进行的物理互动都会暴露其幻象的本质。一个生物用研究动作调查影像时，它可以进行一次对抗你的法术豁免 DC 的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，以判定是否看穿幻象。辨出幻象的生物可以看破该影像，而影像的其他感官效应在该生物看来会变得微弱而模糊。

升环施法： 使用高于三环的法术位时，法术时间持续至被解除且无需专注。

Project Image.name: Project Image
Project Image.description:
You create an illusory copy of yourself that lasts for the duration. The copy can appear at any location within range that you have seen before, regardless of intervening obstacles. The illusion looks and sounds like you, but it is intangible. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears, and the spell ends.

You can see through the illusion’s eyes and hear through its ears as if you were in its space. As a Magic action, you can move it up to 60 feet and make it gesture, speak, and behave in whatever way you choose. It mimics your mannerisms perfectly.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be illusory, since things can pass through it. A creature that takes the Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.

materials.value: a statuette of yourself worth 5+ GP

Giggling Magic.name: Giggling Magic
Giggling Magic.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=Ttrajc4RC5Ut7pkj]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack roll and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Giggling.name: Giggling
Giggling.description: Until the end of its next turn, the target rolls [[/r 1d6]] whenever it makes an ability check or attack and subtracts the number rolled from the D20 Test.

Mind Jolt.name: Mind Jolt
Mind Jolt.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMindSpike0]{Mind Spike} (level 5 version). The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Slowing Breath.name: Slowing Breath
Slowing Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=teMMQNDDIE9XkPN3]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.name: 1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions
1/2 Speed | Action Restrictions.description: The target can’t take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

Ancient Deep Dragon.name: Ancient Deep Dragon
Ancient Deep Dragon.description:
Deep Dragon Lairs

Deep dragons lair in fungus-encrusted caverns of the Underdark or old, forgotten ruins, preferring locations near subterranean bodies of water.

The region containing an adult or ancient deep dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Preservation of Knowledge. Books and other written forms of communication with 1 mile of the lair become magically protected and can’t be damaged by nonmagical means.

Restless Sleep. When a creature finishes a Long Rest within 1 mile of the lair, the creature makes a [[/save con 10 format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature doesn’t reduce its Exhaustion level as a result of finishing that Long Rest. Creatures with Immunity to the Poisoned condition are immune to this effect.

Verdant Growth. Vegetation and fungi within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair grow faster and cover a greater area than normal. Foraging in this area yields twice the usual amount of food. The dragon is immediately aware of the presence of any creature that eats this enhanced vegetation.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dragon makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks.

Nightmare Breath.name: Nightmare Breath
Nightmare Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rQaVvnKj8M4SA05A]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=rQaVvnKj8M4SA05A]]-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of the dragon’s next turn.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair).

Immediately after another creature’s turn, the dragon can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The dragon regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Spore Salvo.name: Spore Salvo
Spore Salvo.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=Rgw7pKnnGrBKiLTs]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=Rgw7pKnnGrBKiLTs]] feet of the dragon that it can see.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Failure or Success: The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性 Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The dragon shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Small or Medium Beast, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Ancient Spirit Dragon.name: Ancient Spirit Dragon
Ancient Spirit Dragon.description:
Draconic Scions of an Ancient Empire

Spirit dragons, sometimes called song dragons, are powerful dragons whose powers stem from the magic and history of fallen realms. They embody the spirit of a bygone age, and so as they grow and mature, they develop an erratic control over time.

A spirit dragon’s primary motivation is to unearth and study the ruins of the ancient realm from which it arose. Spirit dragons share an innate intellectual curiosity, and many have a deep appreciation for the culture and art of humanoid societies.

Spirit dragons find even the most commonplace melodies moving. A song written in the time and region from which a spirit dragon hails can potentially overwhelm the dragon, driving it to either morose despondence or passionate rage.

No two spirit dragons are exactly alike; each individual bears features distinct to the empire from which it hails. Roll on or choose a result from the Spirit Dragon Origins table to determine which lost realm a spirit dragon is from.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifSpiritDragonO rollable resultLabel="The Spirit Dragon Traces Its Origins To …"]

Ancient Spirit Dragon

Ancient spirit dragons have outgrown the petty concerns of the current age. After centuries of studying the culture and beliefs of an ancient empire, a spirit dragon’s personality and outlook are often indistinguishable from that fallen realm’s.

Spirit Dragon Lairs

Spirit dragons haunt the ruined cities and buried monuments of ancient empires.

The region containing an adult or ancient spirit dragon’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Enchanted Acoustics. Creatures within 1 mile of the lair have Advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks that involve singing or playing music. Creatures other than the dragon and its allies in that area have Disadvantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

Time Distortion. While within 1 mile of the lair, creatures age at one-tenth the usual rate.

If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .EUw6BC7eyW5kLfqG]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .Wxu8of2osze75THL]]{Shapechange} (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), [[/item .3xdDEk4D2HbyTKqN]]{Thunderwave} (level 2 version)

1/Day Each: [[/item .v2jBySr9k7JeVljD]]{Legend Lore} (as an action), [[/item .vneFDEEQUgF8ADGA]]{Sequester}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dragon makes three [[/item Rend]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) [[/item Time-Warping Breath]] or (B) [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast [[/item .3xdDEk4D2HbyTKqN]]{Thunderwave} (level 2 version).

Rend.name: Rend
Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Shattering Wave.name: Shattering Wave
Shattering Wave.description: The dragon uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast [[/item .3xdDEk4D2HbyTKqN]]{Thunderwave} (level 2 version)

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Shapechange.name: Shapechange
Shapechange.description:
You shape-shift into another creature for the duration or until you take a Magic action to shape-shift into a different eligible form. The new form must be of a creature that has a Challenge Rating no higher than your level or Challenge Rating. You must have seen the sort of creature before, and it can't be a Construct or an Undead.

When you cast the spell, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the first form into which you shape-shift. These Temporary Hit Points vanish if any remain when the spell ends.

Your game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen form, but you retain your creature type; alignment; personality; Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; Hit Points; Hit Point Dice; proficiencies; and ability to communicate. If you have the Spellcasting feature, you retain it too.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you're in it.

Thunderwave.name: Thunderwave
Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.description:
Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn't actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

materials.value: incense worth 250+ GP, which the spell consumes, and four ivory strips worth 50+ GP each

Sequester.name: Sequester
Sequester.description:
With a touch, you magically sequester an object or a willing creature. For the duration, the target has the Invisible condition and can't be targeted by Divination spells, detected by magic, or viewed remotely with magic.

If the target is a creature, it enters a state of suspended animation; it has the Unconscious condition, doesn't age, and doesn't need food, water, or air.

You can set a condition for the spell to end early. The condition can be anything you choose, but it must occur or be visible within 1 mile of the target. Examples include "after 1,000 years" or "when the tarrasque awakens." This spell also ends if the target takes any damage.

materials.value: gem dust worth 5,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

Sequestered.name: Sequestered
Sequestered.description: If the target is a creature, it enters a state of suspended animation; it has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition, doesn’t age, and doesn’t need food, water, or air. This spell also ends if the target takes any damage.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair).

Immediately after another creature’s turn, the dragon can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The dragon regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性 Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Ruinous Breath.name: Ruinous Breath
Ruinous Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=OXS0MTwPZuofbYxy]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=OXS0MTwPZuofbYxy]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=OXS0MTwPZuofbYxy]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Time-Warping Breath.name: Time-Warping Breath
Time-Warping Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ADXbKsLyXeYvNOWi]], each creature that isn’t currently affected by this breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=ADXbKsLyXeYvNOWi]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=ADXbKsLyXeYvNOWi]].

Failure: The target’s Speed is halved, it can’t take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Speed Halved.name: Speed Halved
Speed Halved.description: The target’s Speed is halved, it can’t take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description: The dragon moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Unearth Ruins.name: Unearth Ruins
Unearth Ruins.description:
The dragon magically raises broken, ancient ruins in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=ZhM1L5HLWSyHQleK]]-foot-radius, [[lookup @target.template.height activity=ZhM1L5HLWSyHQleK]]-foot-high [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=ZhM1L5HLWSyHQleK]] centered on a point it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=ZhM1L5HLWSyHQleK]] feet. Ground in the Cylinder becomes &Reference[Difficult Terrain].

Each creature in the Cylinder when it appears is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=ZhM1L5HLWSyHQleK]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Failure or Success: The dragon can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Smother.name: Smother
Smother.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can give it the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) instead of dealing damage. Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, is &Reference[Suffocating]{suffocating}, and takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of its turns. [[lookup @name lowercase]] rug can smother only one creature at a time.

While grappling the target, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't take this action, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] halves the damage it takes (round down), and the target takes the same amount of damage.

Grappled + Other Conditions.name: Grappled + Other Conditions
Grappled + Other Conditions.description:
The target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) instead of dealing damage.

Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, is &Reference[Suffocating]{suffocating}

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]] ([[lookup @activation.condition activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]]), reach [[lookup @range.value activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] ft. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]).

attack.condition: with Advantage if the target is Grappled by the ankheg

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC).

Acid Spray.name: Acid Spray
Acid Spray.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]]-long, [[lookup @target.template.width activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]]-[[lookup @target.template.units activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]]-wide [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=20GU2JBM5zJfNPD1]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Aranea.name: Aranea
Aranea.description:
Secretive Crafter and Trader

Araneas are reclusive shape-shifters. An aranea’s natural form resembles a bulky, humpbacked spider with two short arms beneath its head. An aranea can shape-shift into a humanoid form or into a multiarmed humanoid-spider hybrid. Araneas live in insular communities, such as the Spider Swamp in Calimshan, where they create beautiful objects that express their artistry and which are sometimes traded to other communities. Most araneas prefer to avoid combat, befuddling their foes long enough to skitter to safety.

Roll or choose a result from the Aranea Crafts table as inspiration for an aranea’s crafting talent.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifAraneaCrafts0 rollable classes="aif caption-top" resultLabel="The Aranea Is Skilled at Crafting …"]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The aranea casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12):

At Will: [[/item .vj2AQYo3tEr0mdQq]]{Friends}, [[/item .Y8rkBuwVMwgjnnkD]]{Silent Image}

1/Day: [[/item .AMKqRAsQ5jqd0aLm]]{Hold Person}

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The aranea shape-shifts into a humanoid form, into a humanoid-spider hybrid form, or back into its true spider form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Silent Image.name: Silent Image
Silent Image.description:
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot Cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects.

As a Magic action, you can cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image.

activation.condition: a bit of fleece

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The aranea makes two attacks, using [[/item .VbTpiwh4QcPNAm1b]]{Bite}, [[/item Slam]], or [[/item .WV5yUbmtYWkrGNVK]]{Sling} in any combination.

Friends.name: Friends
Friends.description:
You magically emanate a sense of friendship toward one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target succeeds automatically if it isn’t a Humanoid, if you’re fighting it, or if you have cast this spell on it within the past 24 hours.

The spell ends early if the target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The spell ends early if the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] target takes damage or if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or force anyone to make a saving throw. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]可以在空气和水中呼吸。

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes four [[/item .mmArcaneBurst000]] attacks.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, requiring no spell components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.name: Misty Step lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w
lSbRnSVRWsTQoh2w.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: 当你看见范围内一名生物施展一道法术时执行

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 7 version)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold} (level 9 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMindBlank0]{Mind Blank} (cast before combat), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTeleport00]{Teleport}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Mind Blank.name: Mind Blank
Mind Blank.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch has Immunity to Psychic damage and the Charmed condition. The target is also unaffected by anything that would sense its emotions or alignment, read its thoughts, or magically detect its location, and no spell—not even @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish}—can gather information about the target, observe it remotely, or control its mind.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description:
This spell instantly transports you and up to eight willing creatures that you can see within range, or a single object that you can see within range, to a destination you select. If you target an object, it must be Large or smaller, and it can't be held or carried by an unwilling creature.

The destination you choose must be known to you, and it must be on the same plane of existence as you. Your familiarity with the destination determines whether you arrive there successfully. The DM rolls [[/gmr 1d100]] and consults the Teleportation Outcome table and the explanations after it.

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplTeleportMi]{Teleportation Outcome}
FamiliarityMishapSimilar AreaOff TargetOn Target
Permanent circle———01–00
Linked object———01–00
Very familiar01–0506–1314–2425–00
Seen casually01–3334–4344–5354–00
Viewed once or described01–4344–5354–7374–00
False destination01–5051–00——

Familiarity. Here are the meanings of the terms in the table's Familiarity column:

  • "Permanent circle" means a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know.
  • "Linked object" means you possess an object taken from the desired destination within the last six months, such as a book from a wizard's library.
  • "Very familiar" is a place you have visited often, a place you have carefully studied, or a place you can see when you cast the spell.
  • "Seen casually" is a place you have seen more than once but with which you aren't very familiar.
  • "Viewed once or described" is a place you have seen once, possibly using magic, or a place you know through someone else's description, perhaps from a map.
  • "False destination" is a place that doesn't exist. Perhaps you tried to scry an enemy's sanctum but instead viewed an illusion, or you are attempting to teleport to a location that no longer exists.

Mishap. The spell's unpredictable magic results in a difficult journey. Each teleporting creature (or the target object) takes [[/damage 3d10 type=force]] damage, and the DM rerolls on the table to see where you wind up (multiple mishaps can occur, dealing damage each time).

Similar Area. You and your group (or the target object) appear in a different area that's visually or thematically similar to the target area. You appear in the closest similar place. If you are heading for your home laboratory, for example, you might appear in another person's laboratory in the same city.

Off Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear [[/r 2d12]] miles away from the destination in a random direction. Roll [[/r 1d8]] for the direction: 1, east; 2, southeast; 3, south; 4, southwest; 5, west; 6, northwest; 7, north; or 8, northeast.

On Target. You and your group (or the target object) appear where you intended.

affects.special: you and up to eight creatures or one object

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
一只漂浮的幽灵手出现在施法距离内你指定的一点。幽灵手持续存在至法术终止。如果幽灵手距你的距离超过 30 尺，或者当你再次施展了该法术时，则现存的幽灵手消失不见。

你可以在施展该法术时使用幽灵手实施一个行为：你可以操控一个物件，或者打开一扇未上锁的门或容器，或者将一件物品放入或取出一个打开的容器，或者将小瓶中的内容物倾倒出来。

在后续的回合中，以一个魔法动作，你可以控制幽灵手再次实施一个行为。作为那个动作的一部分，你可以令幽灵手移动至多 30 尺。

该幽灵手不能攻击，也不能激活魔法物品或承载超过 10 磅重的物质。

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Archpriest.name: Archpriest
Archpriest.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbarmChainMail0]{Chain Mail}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol (Varies)}

Priests

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.pS5jmRPKdOnsgrDJ caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Archpriest

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.IDZFM5AyIAXaIsjg caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmRadiantBurst00]] attacks.

Radiant Burst.name: Radiant Burst
Radiant Burst.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Holy Word.name: Holy Word
Holy Word.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=hDo31s3Eg9EW7GUZ]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=hDo31s3Eg9EW7GUZ]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=hDo31s3Eg9EW7GUZ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Spellcasting. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlameStrik]{Flame Strike} (level 6 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRaiseDead0]{Raise Dead}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplZoneofTrut]{Zone of Truth}

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
你触碰一名生物并魔法性地移除目标身上的下列效应之一：

  • 1 级 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]{力竭}
  • &Reference[Charmed apply=false]{魅惑}或&Reference[Petrified apply=false]{石化}状态
  • 一道诅咒，包括目标因与一件被诅咒魔法物品的同调所陷入的诅咒。
  • 目标某项属性值的减损
  • 目标生命值上限的降低

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Raise Dead.name: Raise Dead
Raise Dead.description:
With a touch, you revive a dead creature if it has been dead no longer than 10 days and it wasn’t Undead when it died.

The creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. This spell also neutralizes any poisons that affected the creature at the time of death.

This spell closes all mortal wounds, but it doesn’t restore missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails.

Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

materials.value: a diamond worth 500+ GP, which the spell consumes

Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 1)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 1).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 2)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 2).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 4)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 4).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).name: Resurrection Sickness (Day 3)
Resurrection Sickness (Day 3).description: Coming back from the dead is an ordeal. The target takes a −4 penalty to D20 Tests. Every time the target finishes a Long Rest, the penalty is reduced by 1 until it becomes 0.

Zone of Truth.name: Zone of Truth
Zone of Truth.description:
You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

Cannot Lie.name: Cannot Lie
Cannot Lie.description:
你在该区域内不能故意说谎。而施法者可以知晓每个受术生物的豁免是成功与否。

你可以意识到该效果的存在，因此你可以主动回避回答那些通常会以谎言答复的问题。你在回答问题时可以闪烁其词、避重就轻，但说的仍然需要是真话。

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell’s level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell’s level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Shortsword.name: Shortsword
Shortsword.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin's next turn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the assassin’s next turn.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .jLa5l9pntsTVrMKH]] or [[/item .dL4668G7zXeC5zyY]] in any combination.

Cunning Action.name: Cunning Action
Cunning Action.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Dash apply=false], the &Reference[Disengage apply=false], or &Reference[Hide apply=false] action.

Azer Pyromancer.name: Azer Pyromancer
Azer Pyromancer.description:
Azers

@Embed[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.content.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.hjy5XDYlj1J5cpV6 caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm"]

Azer Pyromancer

Fire Aura.name: Fire Aura
Fire Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage unless the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

damage.condition: at the end of each of this creature's turns

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 10-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 10 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes makes two [[/item .mmFlameBurst0000]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplElementali], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFireball00]

Elementalism.name: Elementalism
Elementalism.description:
You exert control over the elements, creating one of the following effects within range.

Beckon Air. You create a breeze strong enough to ripple cloth, stir dust, rustle leaves, and close open doors and shutters, all in a 5-foot Cube. Doors and shutters being held open by someone or something aren’t affected.

Beckon Earth. You create a thin shroud of dust or sand that covers surfaces in a 5-foot-square area, or you cause a single word to appear in your handwriting in a patch of dirt or sand.

Beckon Fire. You create a thin cloud of harmless embers and colored, scented smoke in a 5-foot Cube. You choose the color and scent, and the embers can light candles, torches, or lamps in that area. The smoke’s scent lingers for 1 minute.

Beckon Water. You create a spray of cool mist that lightly dampens creatures and objects in a 5-foot Cube. Alternatively, you create 1 cup of clean water either in an open container or on a surface, and the water evaporates in 1 minute.

Sculpt Element. You cause dirt, sand, fire, smoke, mist, or water that can fit in a 1-foot Cube to assume a crude shape (such as that of a creature) for 1 hour.

Beckon Element.name: Beckon Element
Beckon Element.chatFlavor: Fire and water beckoning lasts for 1 minute

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
一只漂浮的幽灵手出现在施法距离内你指定的一点。幽灵手持续存在至法术终止。如果幽灵手距你的距离超过 30 尺，或者当你再次施展了该法术时，则现存的幽灵手消失不见。

你可以在施展该法术时使用幽灵手实施一个行为：你可以操控一个物件，或者打开一扇未上锁的门或容器，或者将一件物品放入或取出一个打开的容器，或者将小瓶中的内容物倾倒出来。

在后续的回合中，以一个魔法动作，你可以控制幽灵手再次实施一个行为。作为那个动作的一部分，你可以令幽灵手移动至多 30 尺。

该幽灵手不能攻击，也不能激活魔法物品或承载超过 10 磅重的物质。

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
明亮的闪光从你的指间飞驰向施法距离内你指定的一点，并随着一声低吼迸成一片烈焰。目标点周围半径 20 尺球状区域内的每个生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败者将受到 8d6 点火焰伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。

区域内所有未被着装或携带的可燃物件会开始燃烧。

升环施法： 使用的法术位每比三环高一环，其伤害就增加 1d6。

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

lJ0WsCTDWAMXkc03.name: Hellish Rebuke lJ0WsCTDWAMXkc03
lJ0WsCTDWAMXkc03.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

activation.condition: taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

It can’t use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

Deadly Aim.name: Deadly Aim
Deadly Aim.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gives itself Advantage on the next attack roll it makes during the current turn. If that attack hits, the target takes an extra [[/damage average]] damage.

Bandit Deceiver.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Daggers (6)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}
