Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .jdOlqVzYs89JuqTB]] and [[/item .qhM3PIWgXdyRCeul]] in any combination.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]可以在空气和水中呼吸。

Coven Magic.name: Coven Magic
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.int.dc]]): @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFindFamili]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplUnseenServ]{Unseen Servant}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
你从异界存在处获得一个预示，关乎你计划在未来 30 分钟内采取的一系列行动的结果。DM 从预示表中选择一个预示。

预示对应结果将是…
吉好的
凶坏的
吉凶并存既好又坏
无既不好也不坏

该法术不会考虑可能改变结果的情况，例如其他法术。

如果你在完成一次长休前多次施展此法术，则第一次施法后每次施法都有累计 25% 的几率得不到答案。

materials.value: specially marked sticks, bones, cards, or other divinatory tokens worth 25+ GP

Find Familiar.name: Find Familiar
Find Familiar.description:
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: Bat, Cat, Frog, Hawk, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Rat, Raven, Spider, Weasel, or another Beast that has a Challenge Rating of 0. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form (see appendix B), though it is a Celestial, Fey, or Fiend (your choice) instead of a Beast. Your familiar acts independently of you, but it obeys your commands.

Telepathic Connection. While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a Bonus Action, you can see through the familiar’s eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses it has.

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the touch. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must take a Reaction to deliver the touch when you cast the spell.

Combat. The familiar is an ally to you and your allies. It rolls its own Initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can’t attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

Disappearance of the Familiar. When the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points, it disappears. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As a Magic action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As a Magic action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 Hit Points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.

One Familiar Only. You can’t have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new eligible form.

materials.value: burning incense worth 10+ GP, which the spell consumes

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn’t know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target’s …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Unseen Servant.name: Unseen Servant
Unseen Servant.description:
This spell creates an Invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 Hit Point, and a Strength of 2, and it can’t attack. If it drops to 0 Hit Points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a Bonus Action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring drinks. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

materials.value: a bit of string and of wood

Vile Appearance.name: Vile Appearance
Vile Appearance.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]], any [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]] that starts its turn within [[lookup @range.value activity=FR0ETDHBas1Z5LfF]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s true form.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Horrific Appearance for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Death Glare.name: Death Glare
Death Glare.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=3uA75vqvubgY300I]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=3uA75vqvubgY300I]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=3uA75vqvubgY300I]] feet.

Failure: If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it drops to 0 Hit Points. Otherwise, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Illusory Appearance.name: Illusory Appearance
Illusory Appearance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]). The spell’s duration is [[lookup @duration.value activity=qY8e7Xm7QYQDXqsd]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=qY8e7Xm7QYQDXqsd]]s.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

Draining Swipe.name: Draining Swipe
Draining Swipe.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target's Strength score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadow} rises from the corpse [[/r 1d4]] hours later.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) to modify the target's Strength Score. When the target roll's their d4 to determine the loss, you can apply the respective AE to the target's sheet.

attack.chatFlavor: On Hit: Target's STR score decreases

Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Demonic Restoration.name: Demonic Restoration
Demonic Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Light Sensitivity.description: While in Bright Light, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Shadow Stealth.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes the &Reference[Hide] action.

Legendary Resistance.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 豁免失败时，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies, and a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.aifShadow0000000]{Shadow} rises from its corpse. The shadow is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s control and shares the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Initiative count but acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Pounce.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Rend]] attack.

Veil of Shadow.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Shadow Stealth, and [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]] of its choice that it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]] [[lookup @range.units activity=ODogaJU4TRqxPSNo]]. of it takes [[/damage average]] damage. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Living Shadow.name: Living Shadow
Living Shadow.description:
While in Dim Light or Darkness, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Resistance to damage that isn’t Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect to manage Damage Resistances in the character sheet's Effects tab. The resistances outlined will need to be manually enabled/disabled.

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item .mmChargedTendril]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmEngulf00000000]].

Charged Tendril.name: Charged Tendril
Charged Tendril.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls the target 5 feet straight toward itself.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=5o0Bh8PQaojx5XMx]] within 5 feet.

Failure: The target is pulled into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space and has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it takes [[/damage average activity=Exfa4q7O4SvXjGt7]] damage at the start of each of its turns. When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature Grappled by this action at a time.

Grappled, Blinded & Restrained.name: Grappled, Blinded & Restrained
Grappled, Blinded & Restrained.description: Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it takes [[/damage average 3d6 type=lightning]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

Bound.name: Bound
Bound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is magically bound to an amulet. While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet’s wearer can telepathically call the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to travel to it, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 60 feet of the amulet’s wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (round up) is transferred to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Spell Storing.name: Spell Storing
Spell Storing.description: A spellcaster who wears the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s amulet can cause the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to store one spell of level 4 or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while within 5 feet of it. The spell has no effect but is stored within the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Any previously stored spell is lost when a new spell is stored. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast the spell stored with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no spell components and using the caster’s spellcasting ability. The stored spell is then lost.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks.

Protection.name: Protection
Protection.description:
Trigger: An attack roll hits the wearer of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Response: The wearer gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack and possibly causing it to miss, until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

utility.condition: An attack roll hits the wearer of the guardian's amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the guardian

Protected.name: Protected
Protected.description: The wearer gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack and possibly causing it to miss, until the start of the bestower's next turn.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Inscrutable.name: Inscrutable
Inscrutable.description: No magic can observe the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Curse of the Riddle]].

Curse of the Riddle.name: Curse of the Riddle
Curse of the Riddle.description:
Intelligence Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=RbCvwBYpqZFD3jac]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is cursed with a riddle. The cursed target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. In addition, if it takes the Magic action, it must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw or that action is wasted.

The cursed target can take a &Reference[Study] action to make a [[/check dc=15 ability=int format=long]], solving the riddle and ending the curse on a success. The curse ends early if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] curses another target.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: The target is cursed with a riddle. The cursed target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplIdentify00]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLocateObje]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]{Remove Curse}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Identify.name: Identify
Identify.description:
You touch an object throughout the spell’s casting. If the object is a magic item or some other magical object, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires Attunement, and how many charges it has, if any. You learn whether any ongoing spells are affecting the item and what they are. If the item was created by a spell, you learn that spell’s name.

If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn which ongoing spells, if any, are currently affecting it.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner’s Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Sphinx of Wonder.description:

Spirit Dragon Wyrmling.name: Spirit Dragon Wyrmling
Spirit Dragon Wyrmling.description:
Draconic Scions of an Ancient Empire

Spirit dragons, sometimes called song dragons, are powerful dragons whose powers stem from the magic and history of fallen realms. They embody the spirit of a bygone age, and so as they grow and mature, they develop an erratic control over time.

A spirit dragon’s primary motivation is to unearth and study the ruins of the ancient realm from which it arose. Spirit dragons share an innate intellectual curiosity, and many have a deep appreciation for the culture and art of humanoid societies.

Spirit dragons find even the most commonplace melodies moving. A song written in the time and region from which a spirit dragon hails can potentially overwhelm the dragon, driving it to either morose despondence or passionate rage.

No two spirit dragons are exactly alike; each individual bears features distinct to the empire from which it hails. Roll on or choose a result from the Spirit Dragon Origins table to determine which lost realm a spirit dragon is from.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifSpiritDragonO rollable resultLabel="The Spirit Dragon Traces Its Origins To …"]

Spirit Dragon Wyrmling

When a dragon egg is found buried among ancient rubble and given the right conditions, a spirit dragon wyrmling might hatch from the egg. Left to its own devices, a wyrmling wanders the ruins that the dragon originated from.

Ruinous Breath.name: Ruinous Breath
Ruinous Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=jpvlh5dedCk83zPl]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=jpvlh5dedCk83zPl]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=jpvlh5dedCk83zPl]].

Success: Half damage.

Time-Warping Breath.name: Time-Warping Breath
Time-Warping Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=JJX4hXDBxdXpYfCG]], each creature that isn’t currently affected by this breath in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=JJX4hXDBxdXpYfCG]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=JJX4hXDBxdXpYfCG]].

Failure: The target’s Speed is halved, it can’t take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Speed Halved.name: Speed Halved
Speed Halved.description: The target’s Speed is halved, it can’t take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Spore of Moander.name: Spore of Moander
Spore of Moander.description:
Hulking Heap of the Rotting God

A spore of Moander is a rotting mass of vegetation infused with the divine power of Moander, dead god of corruption and decay. Spores arise on the Material Plane where Moander’s influence can still be felt: primordial swamps, ancient forests, and miasmic lagoons touched by Abyssal evil.

A spore of Moander has no grand agenda beyond spreading death and sorrow. Still, cultists of Moander look on these terrible creatures with reverence, believing that each spore is a window into the unknowable mind of Moander.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The spore makes four [[/item Tendril]] attacks. Alternatively, it makes two [[/item Tendril]] attacks and uses [[/item Consume]] once.

Tendril.name: Tendril
Tendril.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is Large or smaller, the spore pulls the target 5 feet straight toward itself.

Consume.name: Consume
Consume.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FSLDexnvBWTaGfWA]], one Large or smaller creature within 5 feet.

Failure: The target is pulled into the spore’s space and has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the spore’s turns. When the spore moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The spore can have one Large creature or up to nine Medium or smaller creatures Grappled at a time.

Grappled, Blinded, and Restrained.name: Grappled, Blinded, and Restrained

Rolling Mass.name: Rolling Mass
Rolling Mass.description: The spore doesn’t need to expend extra movement to move through &Reference[Difficult Terrain].

Proboscis.name: Proboscis
Proboscis.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attaches to the target. While attached, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t make Proboscis attacks, and the target takes [[/damage average activity=5xwoPMBiaRBqjFav]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the [[lookup @name lowercase]] as an action.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSlow000000]{Slow} spell, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]).

rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.name: Slow rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg
rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot Cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs<=25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell's gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Foundry Note

The inline roll above will return 1 if it succeeded or 0 if it failed.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description:
An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Amphibious.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]]可以在空气和水中呼吸。

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplControlWea]{Control Weather}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Control Weather.name: Control Weather
Control Weather.description:
You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to cast this spell, and it ends early if you go indoors.

When you cast the spell, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the DM. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes 1d4 × 10 minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the spell ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.

When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can change its direction.

Precipitation
StageCondition
1Clear
2Light clouds
3Overcast or ground fog
4Rain, hail, or snow
5Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard
Temperature
StageCondition
1Heat wave
2Hot
3Warm
4Cool
5Cold
6Freezing
Wind
StageCondition
1Calm
2Moderate wind
3Strong wind
4Gale
5Storm

Incubus Form.name: Incubus Form
Incubus Form.description: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] finishes a Long Rest, it can shape-shift into an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.aifIncubus000000]{Incubus}, using that stat block instead of this one.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmFiendishTouch0]] attack and uses [[/item .mmCharm000000000]] or [[/item .mmDrainingKiss00]].

Charm.name: Charm
Charm.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDominatePe]{Dominate Person} (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]).

Draining Kiss.name: Draining Kiss
Draining Kiss.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kFyuof0SS3nohP0f]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=kFyuof0SS3nohP0f]] Charmed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=kFyuof0SS3nohP0f]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Save.name: Save
Save.chatFlavor: Failure or Success: The target’s HP max. decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Medium or Small Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except its Fly Speed is available only in its true form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. The target has Advantage on the save if you or your allies are fighting it. Whenever the target takes damage, it repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

You have a telepathic link with the Charmed target while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. On your turn, you can use this link to issue commands to the target (no action required), such as "Attack that creature," "Move over there," or "Fetch that object." The target does its best to obey on its turn. If it completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it acts and moves as it likes, focusing on protecting itself.

You can command the target to take a Reaction but must take your own Reaction to do so.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Your Concentration can last longer with a spell slot of level 6 (up to 10 minutes), 7 (up to 1 hour), or 8+ (up to 8 hours).

Dominated.name: Dominated
Dominated.description: Whenever the &Reference[charmed apply=false] target takes damage, it repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Swanmay.name: Swanmay
Swanmay.description:
Shape-Changing Protector of Nature

Swanmays are members of a reclusive order of wilderness defenders. Each bears a primal blessing that allows them to transform into a swan to watch over the lakes and woods they call home. Swanmays get along well with dryads and other creatures devoted to protecting the wilderness.

Roll or choose a result from the Swanmay’s Charge table as inspiration for what a swanmay protects.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifSwanmaysCharg rollable classes="aif caption-top" resultLabel="The Swanmay Is Devoted to Protecting …"]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The swanmay casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .a6Djxc05eQmp2E6H]]{Druidcraft}, [[/item .lrNoj8qm8pnDjqUf]]{Speak with Animals} (swan form only)

1/Day Each: [[/item .SCzzZDhBGSKaYkRq]]{Animal Friendship}, [[/item .Waawq3DjKRZcdyUA]]{Beast Sense}, [[/item .CECqIzzdktD9J7oP]]{Spike Growth}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The swanmay makes two attacks, using [[/item .18CaFo23jBjlIaBk]]{Beak}, [[/item .Q2itZ7NnTtpe07WS]]{Longbow}, or [[/item Scimitar]] in any combination.

Beak (Swan Form Only).name: Beak (Swan Form Only)
Beak (Swan Form Only).description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The swanmay shape-shifts into a Small swan, or it returns to its true humanoid form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except where noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Flyby (Swan Form Only).name: Flyby (Swan Form Only)
Flyby (Swan Form Only).description: The swanmay doesn’t provoke an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks] when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Speak with Animals.name: Speak with Animals
Speak with Animals.description:
For the duration, you can comprehend and verbally communicate with Beasts, and you can use any of the Influence action's skill options with them.

Most Beasts have little to say about topics that don't pertain to survival or companionship, but at minimum, a Beast can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever it has perceived within the past day.

Animal Friendship.name: Animal Friendship
Animal Friendship.description:
Target a Beast that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Beast for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the target, the spells ends.

Spike Growth.name: Spike Growth
Spike Growth.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a [[/check ability=wis skill=prc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Beast Sense.name: Beast Sense
Beast Sense.description: You touch a willing Beast. For the duration, you can perceive through the Beast’s senses as well as your own. When perceiving through the Beast’s senses, you benefit from any special senses it has.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

Swarm of Grasping Hands.name: Swarm of Grasping Hands
Swarm of Grasping Hands.description: [[/attack extended activity=rO8NirkWF6w9GXTc]]. [[/damage average extended activity=rO8NirkWF6w9GXTc]], or [[/damage average activity=hzeHzcSKHC4AvIJQ]] damage if [[lookup @activation.condition activity=hzeHzcSKHC4AvIJQ]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Swarm of Dretches.description:
Dretches

Fetid Aura.description:

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can’t take Reactions.

Poisoned.description:
The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Animate Trees.name: Animate Trees
Animate Trees.description: The [[lookup @name]] magically animates up to two trees it can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=EceTNjzjKWdrMNAy]] feet of itself. Each tree uses the Treant stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, it can't speak, and it lacks this action. The tree takes its turn immediately after the treant on the same initiative count, and it obeys the treant. A tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies, the treant dies, or it is more than 120 feet from the treant. The tree then takes root if possible.

Grasping Root.name: Grasping Root
Grasping Root.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]] [[lookup @range.units activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]].

Failure: The target is pulled up to [[lookup @target.template.size activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]] [[lookup @target.template.units activity=t4WdQWTV3tN4xcdO]]. straight toward the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of six roots. Until the grapple ends, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of its turns.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description: The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of six roots.

Gnash.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=CNoawEWxNhs5HRIk]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=CNoawEWxNhs5HRIk]] Grappled by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: [[lookup @damage.onSave capitalize activity=CNoawEWxNhs5HRIk]] damage.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Loathsome Limbs.name: Loathsome Limbs
Loathsome Limbs.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] ends any turn Bloodied and took 15+ Slashing damage during that turn, one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]l's limbs is severed, falls into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s space, and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmTrollLimb00000]{Troll Limb}. The limb acts immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb, and it grows replacement limbs the next time it regains Hit Points.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect condition in the character sheet's Effects tab to enable each level of Exhaustion. Since the condition can be applied multiple times, the GM must manually manage the level of Exhaustion. There is an active effect available for each level of exhaustion.

Exhaustion 1.name: Exhaustion 1
Exhaustion 1.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

Exhaustion Dead.description: The creature has 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level for each missing limb.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]])). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=falsse] condition and can’t be targeted by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Tail.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC). While Grappled, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=falsse] condition.

Tunneler.name: Tunneler
Tunneler.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Confusing Gaze.name: Confusing Gaze
Confusing Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=tvHG0MEXOUVoCLuO]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=tvHG0MEXOUVoCLuO]]-foot Cone.

Failure: The target can’t take &Reference[Reaction] until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.
